sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

name: pitch
trans: To pitch is to throw something with a particular force or direction, or to present an idea or proposal to someone.

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: treat
trans: To treat is to behave towards someone in a particular way or to provide medical care or attention to someone.

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

name: abuse
trans: To abuse is to use or treat something or someone in a harmful or wrongful manner.

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: beat
trans: To beat is to strike something repeatedly in order to cause damage or to defeat someone in a contest or competition.

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

name: burn
trans: To burn is to cause something to become damaged, charred or destroyed by fire.

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: deposit
trans: To deposit is to put or place something somewhere, especially to leave money in a bank account.

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: print
trans: To print is to reproduce text or images on paper or another medium.

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: raise
trans: To raise is to lift or move something to a higher position or to increase something such as a salary or voice volume.

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: sleep
trans: To sleep is to rest the body and mind by being in a state of unconsciousness.

sentences.english: I usually sleep on my back.
sentences.chinese: 我一般仰卧着睡觉。

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: He’s lucky because at least he has somewhere to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 他算是幸运的，至少还有个睡觉的地方。

detailed_translations.english: to rest your mind and body, usually at night when you are lying in bed with your eyes closed
the natural state of resting your mind and body, usually at night

name: advance
trans: To advance is to move forward or progress, often in a planned or deliberate manner.

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: connect
trans: To connect is to join or link things together or to establish a communication or relationship with someone.

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: consist
trans: To consist is to be made up or composed of something, or to have something as an essential or characteristic part.

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: contribute
trans: To contribute is to give or add something, especially in order to help or improve something else.

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: draw
trans: To draw is to make marks or lines on a surface or to attract something towards oneself.

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: fix
trans: To fix is to repair or mend something or to make something stable or permanent.

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: hire
trans: To hire is to pay someone to work for you or your company.

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: join
trans: To join is to become a part of a group or to connect two or more things together.

sentences.english: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 许多人牺牲周末时间，加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。

sentences.english: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处

sentences.english: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

sentences.english: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
sentences.chinese: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

name: kill
trans: To kill is to cause the death of a living being.

sentences.english: Why did she kill her husband?
sentences.chinese: 她为什么杀死丈夫？

sentences.english: Murray held a gun to his head and threatened to kill him.
sentences.chinese: 默里拿枪指着他的头并威胁要杀了他。

sentences.english: Four people were killed when a train plunged into a flooded river.
sentences.chinese: 火车冲进洪水泛滥的河中，造成四人身亡。

sentences.english: Bleach kills household germs.
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂能够杀灭日常病菌。

sentences.english: Smoking kills.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟会致人死亡。

sentences.english: The out-of-town shopping centre will kill local trade.
sentences.chinese: 城外的购物中心将令本地商业难以为继。

sentences.english: With time to kill, he took a cab to the centre.
sentences.chinese: 还有点时间可以消磨，于是他叫了一辆出租车去市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or animal die

name: sit
trans: To sit is to rest on a chair or other surface with your back upright and your legs bent.

sentences.english: The parliament building sits in a large square.
sentences.chinese: 议会大楼位于一个大广场上。

sentences.english: He’s got a computer sitting on his desk, but he doesn’t use it.
sentences.chinese: 他有一台电脑放在书桌上，但他不用。

sentences.english: My climbing boots were sitting unused in a cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 我的登山靴在橱柜里，一直没有穿。

sentences.english: The house has sat empty for two years.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子已经空置两年了。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or condition

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sit)人名；(东南亚国家华语)硕；(罗)西特

name: tap
trans: To tap is to touch something gently or lightly, often to get someone's attention.

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: win
trans: To win is to come first or be the most successful in a competition or game.

sentences.english: Who’s winning (= who is most successful at this point in the game )?
sentences.chinese: 现在谁领先？

detailed_translations.english: to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
a success or victory, especially in sport

name: attack
trans: To attack is to use force to harm or damage someone or something.

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: claim
trans: To claim is to state that something is true or belongs to you.

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: drag
trans: To drag is to pull something along the ground or behind you with force.

sentences.english: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走
detailed_translations.english: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: drink
trans: To drink is to consume a liquid through your mouth.

sentences.english: You should drink plenty of water.
sentences.chinese: 你应该大量喝水。

sentences.english: What would you like to drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝点什么？

sentences.english: Take a seat while I get you something to drink .
sentences.chinese: 请坐，我去给你倒杯喝的。

sentences.english: She filled the glass and drank.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子倒满后喝了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

name: guess
trans: To guess is to make a prediction or estimation about something without having all the information.

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

name: pull
trans: To pull is to use force to move something towards you or away from something else.

sentences.english: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
sentences.chinese: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

sentences.english: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

name: wear
trans: To wear is to have something on your body as clothing or an accessory.

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

name: wonder
trans: To wonder is to think about something with curiosity or doubt.

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: count
trans: To count is to calculate the number of something.

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: doubt
trans: To doubt is to have uncertainty or lack of belief in something.

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: feed
trans: To feed is to provide food or sustenance to a living being.

sentences.english: Have you fed the cat?
sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: impress
trans: To impress is to make someone feel admiration or respect towards you or something else.

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: repeat
trans: To repeat is to do or say something again.

sentences.english: Can you repeat your question?
sentences.chinese: 你能重复一遍你的问题吗？

sentences.english: Sorry - could you repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起——你能再说一遍吗？

sentences.english: It is not, I repeat not, my fault.
sentences.chinese: 那不是我的错，我再说一遍，不是。

sentences.english: It was a terrible journey - I hope we don’t have a repeat performance (= have the same thing happen again ) on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 这一路上太糟糕了——我希望回程可不要再发生同样的事。

detailed_translations.english: to say or write something again
an event that is very like something that happened before

name: seek
trans: To seek is to look for or search for something.

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: sing
trans: To sing is to produce musical sounds with your voice.

sentences.english: She can sing beautifully.
sentences.chinese: 她唱歌很好听。

sentences.english: Most children enjoy singing.
sentences.chinese: 大多数孩子都喜欢唱歌。

sentences.english: We had a great time singing some of the old songs .
sentences.chinese: 我们唱了一些老歌，非常开心。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to sing in tune (= sing the correct notes ) .
sentences.chinese: 我唱歌总是跑调。

sentences.english: She patiently sang the baby to sleep .
sentences.chinese: 她耐心地唱歌哄宝宝入睡。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a musical sound with your voice

name: slide
trans: To slide is to move smoothly along a surface.

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

name: strip
trans: To strip is to remove clothing or covering from something.

sentences.english: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
sentences.chinese: 把床单撤下来清洗。

sentences.english: a strip of paper
sentences.chinese: 一张纸条

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

name: wish
trans: To wish is to want or desire something.

sentences.english: Close your eyes and make a wish.
sentences.chinese: 闭上眼睛许个愿。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen
to want something to be true although you know it is either impossible or unlikely

name: collect
trans: To collect is to gather or accumulate things of a similar type.

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: combine
trans: To combine is to join two or more things together into one.

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: command
trans: To command is to give an order or instruction to someone or something.

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: dig
trans: To dig is to break up and move soil, dirt, or other material with a tool, such as a shovel or pickaxe.

sentences.english: Dig down about 6 inches.
sentences.chinese: 往下挖大约六英寸深。

detailed_translations.english: to move earth, snow etc, or to make a hole in the ground, using a spade or your hands

name: divide
trans: To divide is to separate something into two or more parts or groups.

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: hang
trans: To hang is to attach or suspend something from a surface, such as a wall or ceiling.

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: hunt
trans: To hunt is to search for or pursue wild animals for food or sport.

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: march
trans: To march is to walk in a group with a regular, steady step, usually for a specific purpose or occasion.

sentences.english: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
sentences.chinese: 8月29日皇家军队开进因弗内斯。

sentences.english: The police decided not to ban the march.
sentences.chinese: 警方决定不禁止这次示威游行。

detailed_translations.english: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

name: mention
trans: To mention is to speak or write about something briefly or casually.

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: smell
trans: To smell is to detect or perceive an odor with the nose.

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to notice or recognize a particular smell
the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

name: survey
trans: To survey is to examine or study something in detail.

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: tie
trans: To tie is to fasten or secure something with a knot or other means.

sentences.english: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.
sentences.chinese: 他把塑料袋的两头系在一起。

detailed_translations.english: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points

detailed_translations.chinese: 领带；平局；鞋带；领结；不分胜负
detailed_translations.english: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men

name: escape
trans: To escape is to get free from a situation or place from which it is difficult or impossible to get away.

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: expose
trans: To expose is to reveal or make something known that was previously hidden or secret.

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: gather
trans: To gather is to collect or bring together in one place.

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: hate
trans: To hate is to feel intense or passionate dislike or animosity towards someone or something.

sentences.english: It’s the kind of movie you either love or hate.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种你要么喜欢要么讨厌的电影。

sentences.english: He hates his job.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike something very much

name: repair
trans: To repair is to fix or restore something that is broken or damaged.

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

name: scratch
trans: To scratch is to make a mark or tear on a surface by rubbing or scraping it with a sharp or rough object.

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

name: strike
trans: To strike is to hit or impact something forcefully and often repeatedly.

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: employ
trans: To employ is to hire or engage someone to do a job or task.

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: hurt
trans: To hurt is to cause physical or emotional pain or harm to someone or something.

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

name: laugh
trans: To laugh is to express amusement or joy with sounds made by the mouth and throat.

sentences.english: Maria looked at him and laughed.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚看着他大笑起来。

sentences.english: Tony was laughing so hard he had to steady himself on the table.
sentences.chinese: 托尼笑得太厉害了，靠着桌子才能让自己站稳。

sentences.english: Nora laughed so much that she nearly cried.
sentences.chinese: 诺拉笑得眼泪都快出来了。

sentences.english: He couldn’t help it; he burst out laughing (= suddenly started laughing ).
sentences.chinese: 他情不自禁地放声大笑起来。

sentences.english: He’s one of the few writers who can make me laugh out loud.
sentences.chinese: 有几位作家能让我放声大笑，他是其中之一。

sentences.english: He gave a short laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了一声。

detailed_translations.english: to make sounds with your voice, usually while you are smiling, because you think something is funny
the act of laughing or the sound you make when you laugh

name: lay
trans: To lay is to put or place something in a particular position or location.

sentences.english: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。

sentences.english: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

detailed_translations.chinese: 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴
detailed_translations.english: a poem or song

name: respond
trans: To respond is to answer or reply to something that has been said or done.

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: split
trans: To split is to divide or separate something into two or more parts or pieces.

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

name: strain
trans: To strain is to exert oneself physically or mentally to accomplish something or to put pressure on something to make it bend or stretch.

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: struggle
trans: To struggle is to try very hard to do something that is difficult or to overcome a problem.

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

name: swim
trans: To swim is to move through water using your body, arms, and legs.

sentences.english: Let’s go swimming this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我们游泳去吧。

sentences.english: kids learning to swim the backstroke
sentences.chinese: 学习仰泳的孩子们

sentences.english: She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
sentences.chinese: 她是第一个游过英吉利海峡的女性。

detailed_translations.english: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs
a period of time that you spend swimming

name: train
trans: To train is to teach someone a skill or to prepare for a task or activity through practice and instruction.

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

name: wash
trans: To wash is to clean something with water and often soap or detergent.

sentences.english: Those jeans need a good wash (= a thorough wash ).
sentences.chinese: 那条牛仔裤要好好洗一洗了。

sentences.english: I’ll just have a quick wash before we go out.
sentences.chinese: 我很快洗个澡，然后我们就出门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗涤；洗的衣服；化妆水；冲积物
detailed_translations.english: an act of cleaning something using soap and water
to clean something using water and a type of soap

name: waste
trans: To waste is to use something in a way that does not produce any benefit or value or to allow something to be unused or unused efficiently.

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

name: convert
trans: To convert is to change something into a different form or to cause someone to adopt a different belief or opinion.

sentences.english: a 19th-century converted barn
sentences.chinese: 由19世纪谷仓改建的房子

detailed_translations.english: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

name: crash
trans: To crash is to collide with something forcefully and often accidentally or to experience a sudden and significant decrease in value or success.

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: fold
trans: To fold is to bend or crease something to make it smaller or more compact or to stop participating in something.

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
sentences.chinese: 沿虚线将纸折起来。

sentences.english: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
sentences.chinese: 对折的话就能放下了。

detailed_translations.english: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

name: grab
trans: To grab is to take hold of something quickly and often forcefully.

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: hide
trans: To hide is to conceal oneself or something from view or discovery.

sentences.english: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
sentences.chinese: 她在一堆书的后面藏了一瓶杜松子酒。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found

name: miss
trans: To miss is to fail to hit, catch, or make contact with something or to feel sadness or longing for someone or something that is absent or lost.

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment with Miss Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 我想约一下泰勒小姐。

detailed_translations.english: used in front of the family name of a woman who is not married to address her politely, to write to her, or to talk about her

name: permit
trans: To permit is to allow or authorize something to happen or to give permission for something to be done.

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: quote
trans: To quote is to repeat or reproduce someone else's words or to provide a price estimate for a product or service.

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: recover
trans: To recover is to return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength after an illness, injury, or setback or to retrieve something that has been lost or stolen.

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: resolve
trans: To resolve is to settle or solve a problem or conflict or to make a firm decision to do something.

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: roll
trans: To roll is to move forward or backward by rotating on an axis or to flatten or shape something by pressing it with a cylindrical object.

sentences.english: The ball rolled into the street.
sentences.chinese: 球滚到了街上。

sentences.english: There was silence as the cameras started to roll.
sentences.chinese: 摄影机开始转动，大家安静了下来。

detailed_translations.english: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

name: sink
trans: To sink is to descend below the surface of a liquid or to fall or drop downward.

sentences.english: Their motorboat struck a rock and began to sink.
sentences.chinese: 他们的摩托艇触了礁，开始下沉。

sentences.english: The kids watched as the coin sank to the bottom of the pool.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们看着那枚硬币沉到池底。

sentences.english: The heavy guns sank up to their barrels in the mud.
sentences.chinese: 这些沉重的大炮深陷在泥里，只露出炮管。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下沉，沉没；降低，下落；陷入；衰退，恶化
detailed_translations.english: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使下沉，使沉没；降低；掘，挖，凿
detailed_translations.english: to go down below the surface of water, mud etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 水槽， 水池， 洗涤槽
detailed_translations.english: a large open container that you fill with water and use for washing yourself, washing dishes etc

name: slip
trans: To slip is to slide or lose one's footing on a surface or to make a mistake or error.

sentences.english: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 本悄悄地溜出了房间。

sentences.english: One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
sentences.chinese: 警察到来时，一个男子设法溜出了俱乐部。

sentences.english: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须好好准备，一定不要有差错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑跤，滑落，溜；下降，跌落；悄悄放进
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
A slip is a small or unimportant mistake

name: suspect
trans: To suspect is to believe or think that someone is guilty or responsible for something based on available evidence or to feel distrustful or skeptical about something.

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: swing
trans: To swing is to move back and forth or from side to side on a fixed point or to hit something with a swinging motion.

sentences.english: Let your arms swing as you walk.
sentences.chinese: 边走边摆动双臂。

sentences.english: a sign swinging in the wind
sentences.chinese: 在风中摇摆的指示牌

sentences.english: He was swinging his bag back and forth .
sentences.chinese: 他前后甩动着他的包。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 她左右晃动着两条腿。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 他对准球猛地挥拍一击。

detailed_translations.english: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this
a swinging movement or rhythm

name: twist
trans: To twist is to bend or turn something out of its natural shape or to distort or change the meaning of something.

sentences.english: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手开始拧她拎着的那个包的拎柄。

sentences.english: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了，嘴巴慢慢一歪，带着嘲笑的意味。

detailed_translations.english: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape
a twisting action or movement

name: concentrate
trans: To concentrate is to focus one's attention or mental effort on a particular task or objective.

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: estimate
trans: To estimate is to make an educated guess or approximation of something, often based on limited information or experience.

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: prompt
trans: To prompt is to encourage or motivate someone to do something or to remind someone of what they are supposed to do.

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: refuse
trans: To refuse is to decline or reject something that is offered or asked for.

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: regret
trans: To regret is to feel sorrow or disappointment about something that has happened or something that you have done.

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: reveal
trans: To reveal is to make something known or to uncover or disclose something that was previously hidden or secret.

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: rush
trans: To rush is to move or do something quickly, often with urgency or in a hurry.

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: shake
trans: To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly and repeatedly, or to cause something to do so.

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

name: shift
trans: To shift is to move or cause to move from one position, direction, or focus to another.

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: shine
trans: To shine is to give off or reflect bright light, or to excel or be outstanding in a particular way.

sentences.english: The sun was shining .
sentences.chinese: 阳光照耀。

sentences.english: The moon shone brightly in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 皓月当空。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出光；反射光，闪耀；出类拔萃，表现突出；露出；照耀；显露；出众
detailed_translations.english: to produce bright light

detailed_translations.chinese: 光亮，光泽；好天气；擦亮；晴天；擦皮鞋；鬼把戏或诡计
detailed_translations.english: the brightness that something has when light shines on it

name: steal
trans: To steal is to take something without permission or to do something dishonest or unfair in order to gain an advantage.

sentences.english: Boys broke into a shop and stole £45 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们闯进一家商店，盗走了45英镑现金。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that belongs to someone else
to be very cheap

name: suck
trans: To suck is to draw in or take in with the mouth, or to be of poor quality or unsatisfactory.

sentences.english: They waited in silence and sucked their sweets.
sentences.chinese: 他们静静地等着，吮着糖果。

detailed_translations.english: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in
an act of sucking

name: surround
trans: To surround is to enclose or encircle someone or something completely.

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: bear
trans: To bear is to carry or support the weight of something, or to endure or tolerate something difficult or unpleasant.

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

name: dare
trans: To dare is to have the courage or audacity to do something or to challenge someone to do something.

sentences.english: He wanted to ask her, but he didn’t dare.
sentences.chinese: 他想问她，但又不敢。

sentences.english: ‘I’ll tell Dad.’ ‘You wouldn’t dare!’
sentences.chinese: “我要告诉爸爸。” “谅你也不敢！”

sentences.english: How dare you accuse me of lying!
sentences.chinese: 你竟敢说我撒谎！

detailed_translations.english: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

name: delay
trans: To delay is to put off or postpone something, or to take longer than expected to do something.

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: hurry
trans: To hurry is to move or act quickly or to rush or urge someone to do something quickly.

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

name: invite
trans: To invite is to ask someone to come or join, often to a social event or gathering.

sentences.english: I’m afraid I wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我没有受到邀请。

sentences.english: Successful candidates will be invited for interview next week.
sentences.chinese: 通过甄别的候选人将获邀于下周参加面试。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

name: kiss
trans: To kiss is to touch or press your lips to someone or something as a sign of affection, greeting, or respect.

sentences.english: Maggie leaned forward and kissed her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉俯身吻了她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Georgina took him in her arms and kissed him on the lips.
sentences.chinese: 乔治娜抱住他，吻他的嘴唇。

sentences.english: Jim and Mary kissed (= they kissed each other ).
sentences.chinese: 吉姆和玛丽接了吻。

detailed_translations.english: to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
to touch someone with your lips as a greeting, to show them love, or as part of a sexual relationship
an act of kissing

name: marry
trans: To marry is to enter into a legal or formal union with another person as partners in a romantic relationship.

sentences.english: He married Bea in 1925.
sentences.chinese: 他在1925年娶了贝亚。

sentences.english: I’m going to ask her to marry me on St Valentine’s Day.
sentences.chinese: 我打算在情人节向她求婚。

sentences.english: She married young (= at a young age ) .
sentences.chinese: 她结婚早。

sentences.english: People in higher social classes are more likely to marry late (= when they are older than is usual ) .
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层较高的人士倾向于晚婚。

sentences.english: Sophia had, in a sense, married beneath her (= married someone of a lower social class than her ) .
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在某种意义上是下嫁了。

detailed_translations.english: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife
if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

name: pop
trans: To pop is to make a sudden or explosive sound, or to put something quickly into a particular place or position.

sentences.english: The window opened and a dog's head popped out.
sentences.chinese: 窗子打开了，冷不防一只狗探出头来。

sentences.english: An idea suddenly popped into his head.
sentences.chinese: 他突然想到了一个主意。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly appear, especially when not expected

name: pray
trans: To pray is to communicate with a higher power or deity, often asking for guidance, help, or forgiveness.

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

name: pretend
trans: To pretend is to act or behave in a way that is not genuine or sincere, often to deceive or hide something.

sentences.english: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

sentences.english: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
sentences.chinese: 他并没睡着，不过是装睡而已。

sentences.english: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。

sentences.english: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不可以娶她，装作娶她无妨是不对的。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun
imaginary or not real - used especially by children

name: punch
trans: To punch is to hit someone or something with a closed fist, often as a way of expressing anger or frustration.

sentences.english: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
sentences.chinese: 守卫在我的票上打孔后，我就上去了。

sentences.english: a hole punch
sentences.chinese: 打孔器

detailed_translations.english: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

name: quit
trans: To quit is to stop or give up something, often a job or activity, or to leave or abandon something.

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: reply
trans: To reply is to respond or answer to a question, message, or request.

sentences.english: I asked Clive where he was going, but he didn’t reply.
sentences.chinese: 我问克莱夫到哪儿去，但他没有回答。

sentences.english: Sorry it took me so long to reply.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我过了这么久才回复。

sentences.english: ‘Did you see Simon today?’ ‘Of course,’ Nathalie replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “你今天见到西蒙了吗？”“当然啦。”纳萨莉笑着答道。

sentences.english: I tried calling, but there was no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我试着打电话去，但没有人接。

detailed_translations.english: to answer someone by saying or writing something
something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

name: resist
trans: To resist is to oppose or withstand something, often as a way of fighting against it or protecting oneself.

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: rip
trans: To rip is to tear or cut something quickly and forcefully, often causing damage or destruction.

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

name: rub
trans: To rub is to apply pressure and friction to something with your hands or an object, often to clean or soothe it.

sentences.english: You’ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想把它弄干净，就得更使劲地擦。

sentences.english: I hurriedly rubbed myself dry.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧把自己擦干。

detailed_translations.english: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

name: smile
trans: To smile is to make a happy or friendly facial expression by curving the corners of the mouth and showing the teeth.

sentences.english: her smiling face
sentences.chinese: 她的笑脸

detailed_translations.english: to make your mouth curve upwards, in order to be friendly or because you are happy or amused
an expression in which your mouth curves upwards, when you are being friendly or are happy or amused

name: spell
trans: To spell is to write or say the letters or words of a word in the correct order.

sentences.english: How do you spell ‘juice’?
sentences.chinese: juice 怎么拼？

sentences.english: Pupils should know how to spell commonly used words.
sentences.chinese: 小学生应该知道常用词的拼法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拼，拼写；意味着；招致；拼成；迷住；轮值
detailed_translations.english: to form a word by writing or naming the letters in order
a piece of magic that someone does, or the special words or ceremonies used in doing it

name: stretch
trans: To stretch is to lengthen or extend one's body or limbs, usually in order to improve flexibility or prepare for physical activity.

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: tear
trans: To tear is to pull or rip apart forcefully, usually resulting in damage to the object being torn.

sentences.english: The children were all in tears .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们全都哭了。

sentences.english: She came home in floods of tears .
sentences.chinese: 她泪流满面地回到家里。

sentences.english: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
sentences.chinese: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。

sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

detailed_translations.english: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying

name: wake
trans: To wake is to become conscious after sleeping or to cause someone to become conscious by making noise or touching them.

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: wrap
trans: To wrap is to cover or enclose something completely, often using paper or cloth.

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: was
trans: Was is the past tense of the verb "to be," which is used to indicate the existence or identity of something or someone in the past.

name: like
trans: To like is to enjoy or appreciate something or someone, often resulting in a positive emotional response.

sentences.english: I like your jacket.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你这件上衣。

sentences.english: I don’t really like classical music.
sentences.chinese: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。

sentences.english: Do you like this colour?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？

sentences.english: I like my coffee quite weak.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。

sentences.english: I don’t like it when you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。

sentences.english: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?
sentences.chinese: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？

sentences.english: I quite like their new album.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。

sentences.english: We really liked the film.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。

sentences.english: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

sentences.english: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想当单亲家长。

sentences.english: Would you like a drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝一杯吗？

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

name: even
trans: To even is to make something level or equal, or to balance out differences between two things.

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: film
trans: To film is to record or capture moving images on camera or video, often for entertainment or documentation purposes.

sentences.english: Have you seen any good films recently?
sentences.chinese: 你最近看过什么好的影片吗？

sentences.english: I shot five rolls of film on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 我在度假时拍了五卷胶卷。

sentences.english: a film of oil on the surface of the water
sentences.chinese: 水面上的一层油

detailed_translations.english: a story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television

name: water
trans: To water is to give plants or crops liquid in order to help them grow, or to provide a source of hydration for humans and animals.

sentences.english: There’s water all over the bathroom floor.
sentences.chinese: 浴室地面上都是水。

sentences.english: Does anyone want a drink of water?
sentences.chinese: 有谁想喝杯水吗？

sentences.english: a glass of sparkling mineral water
sentences.chinese: 一杯有气矿泉水

sentences.english: All rooms have hot and cold running water.
sentences.chinese: 所有房间都有冷热自来水供应。

sentences.english: Pour boiling water over the rice and let it soak.
sentences.chinese: 在大米中倒入沸水浸泡。

sentences.english: a fresh water spring
sentences.chinese: 淡水泉

sentences.english: When dealing with a burst pipe, always turn off the water first.
sentences.chinese: 处理破裂水管时，一定要先把水关掉。

sentences.english: contamination of the local water supply
sentences.chinese: 当地供水受到污染

sentences.english: Will you water my houseplants while I’m away?
sentences.chinese: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？

sentences.english: The garden needs watering daily.
sentences.chinese: 花园每天都需要浇水。

detailed_translations.english: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc
if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them

name: been
trans: Been is the past participle of the verb "to be," which is used to indicate the existence or identity of something or someone in the past.

name: well
trans: To well is to rise to the surface or overflow, often in reference to a liquid.

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: James reads quite well for his age.
sentences.chinese: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说，他的阅读能力算不错了。

sentences.english: All the team played very well today.
sentences.chinese: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。

sentences.english: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。

sentences.english: The festival was very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 节庆活动组织得很好。

sentences.english: The concert went very well.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地
detailed_translations.english: in a successful or satisfactory way
healthy

name: were
trans: Were is the past tense of the verb "to be," which is used to indicate the existence or identity of something or someone in the past.

name: example
trans: To example is to provide a sample or illustration of something in order to clarify or demonstrate its meaning.

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

name: own
trans: To own is to have legal possession or control over something, often referring to property or assets.

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: study
trans: To study is to examine or learn about a subject or topic in depth, often through research or practice.

sentences.english: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
sentences.chinese: 最近的调查表明，女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

sentences.english: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

sentences.english: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
sentences.chinese: 留出一段时间专门用于学习

sentences.english: I’ve been studying English for six years
sentences.chinese: 我学英语已有六年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 研究 (对某一课题或问题的)；中文释义: 学习 (尤指在家里或放学后的)
detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义: 学习，攻读
detailed_translations.english: to learn about a subject at school, university etc

name: must
trans: Must is a modal verb used to indicate necessity or obligation.

sentences.english: All passengers must wear seat belts.
sentences.chinese: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。

sentences.english: It’s getting late. I really must go.
sentences.chinese: 天晚了，我真的必须走了。

sentences.english: You must work hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必须努力工作。

sentences.english: We must all be patient.
sentences.chinese: 我们都必须耐心。

sentences.english: Must I pay now?
sentences.chinese: 我必须现在付款吗？

sentences.english: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
sentences.chinese: 要启动引擎，绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。

sentences.english: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
sentences.chinese: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

detailed_translations.english: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order

name: form
trans: To form is to create or shape something, often by combining multiple parts or elements.

sentences.english: We oppose racism in all its forms.
sentences.chinese: 我们反对各种形式的种族主义。

sentences.english: The female form is a thing of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 女性形体是一种美。

sentences.english: The rocks were formed more than 4,000 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石是40多亿年前形成的。

detailed_translations.english: the way something is or appears to be
to start to exist, or make something start to exist, especially as the result of a natural process

name: air
trans: To air is to expose something to the open atmosphere or circulate fresh air in a space.

sentences.english: Let’s go outside and get some fresh air.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去呼吸些新鲜空气吧。

sentences.english: You need to put some air in the tyres.
sentences.chinese: 你得给轮胎充气了。

sentences.english: Flames leapt into the air.
sentences.chinese: 火苗蹿向天空。

sentences.english: He fell 2,000 metres through the air without a parachute.
sentences.chinese: 他没用降落伞在空中下落了2,000米。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of gases around the Earth, that we breathe

name: place
trans: To place is to put something in a specific location or position.

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
sentences.chinese: 一定要把钥匙放在安全的地方。

sentences.english: I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
sentences.chinese: 我这一天尽是在东奔西跑。

sentences.english: The place was full of screaming children.
sentences.chinese: 那地方全是大叫大嚷的孩子们。

sentences.english: He was threatening to burn the place down.
sentences.chinese: 他扬言要把那地方烧毁。

sentences.english: She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
sentences.chinese: 她再也没回过事故发生的地点。

sentences.english: The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
sentences.chinese: 这个剧院酒吧是我们见面的老地方。

sentences.english: We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我们住在一个叫阿尔伯里格的地方。

sentences.english: The wall was quite damp in places (= in some places ) .
sentences.chinese: 墙上有几处很潮湿。

sentences.english: Did the accident happen at your place of work (= the place where you work ) ?
sentences.chinese: 事故是在你的工作地点发生的吗？

sentences.english: It took us ages to find a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们花了好长时间才找到一个住处。

detailed_translations.english: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc

name: number
trans: To number is to assign a numerical value or label to something in a specific sequence.

sentences.english: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。

sentences.english: Add all the numbers together.
sentences.chinese: 把所有数字加起来。

sentences.english: Answer question number 4.
sentences.chinese: 回答第4题。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity

name: part
trans: To part is to separate or divide something into distinct sections or pieces.

sentences.english: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
sentences.chinese: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

sentences.english: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
sentences.chinese: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

name: field
trans: To field is to play a position or perform a role on a sports team or in a specific industry or profession.

sentences.english: a view of green fields and rolling hills
sentences.chinese: 田野青翠、丘陵起伏的景色

sentences.english: Fans cheered as the players took the field (= went onto the field ) .
sentences.chinese: 球员上场时球迷们欢呼起来。

detailed_translations.english: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

name: fish
trans: To fish is to catch or attempt to catch aquatic animals, usually with a rod and reel or other fishing gear.

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝

sentences.english: Dad really loves to fish.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

name: process
trans: To process is to perform a series of actions to accomplish a particular task or goal.

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: heat
trans: To heat is to make something warmer by increasing its temperature.

sentences.english: Ice needs heat to melt.
sentences.chinese: 冰需要热才能融化。

sentences.english: Insulating the attic is a good way to reduce heat loss.
sentences.chinese: 为阁楼安装隔热层是减少热量流失的好方法。

sentences.english: The heat was making them tired.
sentences.chinese: 炎热的天气令他们疲倦。

sentences.english: Heat the milk until it boils.
sentences.chinese: 把牛奶煮开。

detailed_translations.english: warmth or the quality of being hot
to make something become warm or hot

name: hand
trans: To hand is to give something to someone using your hand.

sentences.english: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.english: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.english: the hour hand
sentences.chinese: 时针

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things

name: experience
trans: To experience is to have a particular event or situation happen to you or to feel a particular emotion.

sentences.english: The advice in the booklet reflects the practical experience we have gained (= experience gained by actually doing something, rather than knowledge from books etc ).
