trans: To weekend is to spend time relaxing or engaging in leisure activities over the weekend.

sentences.english: Are you doing anything nice this weekend?
sentences.chinese: 这个周末你有什么好的安排？

sentences.english: Tony has been unwell over the weekend (= during the weekend ).
sentences.chinese: 托尼这个周末身体不舒服。

sentences.english: We’re going to Paris for a long weekend (= Saturday and Sunday, and also Friday or Monday, or both ).
sentences.chinese: 我们要到巴黎去度一个长周末。

detailed_translations.chinese: 周末，周末休假；周末聚会
detailed_translations.english: Saturday and Sunday, especially considered as time when you do not work
to spend the weekend somewhere

name: yard
trans: To yard is to gather and store something, such as lumber or scrap metal, in a yard or other designated area.

sentences.english: a hundred yards away
sentences.chinese: 100码外

sentences.english: an area of 9,000 square yards
sentences.chinese: 面积为9,000平方码的一片区域

detailed_translations.chinese: 院子；码（英制中丈量长度单位，1码=3英尺）；庭院；帆桁
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to three feet or 0.91 metres

name: alarm
trans: To alarm is to cause fear or anxiety by alerting someone to potential danger.

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: bend
trans: To bend is to curve or flex something, typically a body part or object.

sentences.english: Lee bent and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

detailed_translations.english: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
to become curved and no longer flat or straight
a curved part of something, especially a road or river

name: bicycle
trans: To bicycle is to ride a bicycle.

sentences.english: Can James ride a bicycle yet?
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯会骑自行车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet

name: bite
trans: To bite is to use the teeth to cut or grip something.

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

name: blind
trans: To blind is to deprive someone of sight or the ability to see.

sentences.english: Doctors think he will go blind.
sentences.chinese: 医生们认为他会失明。

sentences.english: blind faith/obedience
sentences.chinese: 盲目的信念；盲从

detailed_translations.english: not able to see

name: bottle
trans: To bottle is to put a liquid into a bottle for storage or transportation.

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 一个空瓶子

detailed_translations.english: a container with a narrow top for keeping liquids in, usually made of plastic or glass
to put a liquid, especially wine or beer, into a bottle after you have made it

name: cable
trans: To cable is to send or transmit information or data using a cable or wire.

sentences.english: The miners rode a conveyance attached to a cable made of braided steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们乘坐连着钢索的缆车。

sentences.english: cables and switches for computers
sentences.chinese: 电脑的缆线和开关

sentences.english: She sent a cable to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲发了封电报。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong metal rope used on ships, to support bridges etc

name: candle
trans: To candle is to examine the contents of an egg by shining a light through it.

sentences.english: The candle flickered in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 烛光在风中闪烁不定。

sentences.english: The candle flickered and then went out.
sentences.chinese: 一开始蜡烛摇曳不定， 然后就灭了。

sentences.english: When the candle was only half an inch high it flickered out and the room became dark.
sentences.chinese: 蜡烛只有半英寸长时，烛光忽闪忽闪地熄灭了，于是房间一片漆黑。

detailed_translations.english: a stick of  wax  with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light

name: clerk
trans: To clerk is to work as a clerk, typically in a store or office.

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: cloud
trans: To cloud is to obscure or make something unclear or confusing.

sentences.english: Dark clouds floated across the moon.
sentences.chinese: 乌云飘过月亮。

sentences.english: A cloud of steam rose into the air.
sentences.chinese: 一团水蒸气升到空中。

sentences.english: Fears of renewed terrorist attacks cast a cloud over the event (= spoilt the happy situation ) .
sentences.chinese: 对恐怖分子再次发动袭击的担心给这次活动蒙上了一层阴影。

detailed_translations.english: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water

name: concert
trans: To concert is to plan or arrange something in cooperation with others.

sentences.english: a rock concert
sentences.chinese: 摇滚音乐会

sentences.english: a concert of French choral music
sentences.chinese: 法国合唱音乐会

sentences.english: We were going to a concert in Bath Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听一场在巴斯修道院内举行的音乐会。

sentences.english: She still does about 100 concerts every year.
sentences.chinese: 她每年仍然举行100场左右的演唱会。

detailed_translations.english: a performance given by musicians or singers

detailed_translations.chinese: 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的

name: counter
trans: To counter is to oppose or respond to something with a contrary argument or action.

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: dirty
trans: To dirty is to make something unclean or soiled.

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

name: flower
trans: To flower is to produce blossoms or blooms.

sentences.english: a lovely rose bush with delicate pink flowers
sentences.chinese: 一簇开着娇嫩的粉红色花朵的美丽蔷薇

sentences.english: fields full of beautiful wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 开满美丽野花的田野

sentences.english: It was May, and the apple trees were all in flower.
sentences.chinese: 那是个5月，苹果树开满了花。

detailed_translations.english: a coloured or white part that a plant or tree produces before fruit or seeds

name: grandfather
trans: To grandfather is to exempt something or someone from a new rule or regulation due to their previous status or position.

sentences.english: His grandfather was a professor.
sentences.chinese: 他爷爷曾是位教授。

detailed_translations.english: the father of your father or mother

name: harm
trans: To harm is to cause physical or emotional damage or injury to someone or something.

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: knee
trans: To knee is to strike or hit something with the knee.

sentences.english: Lucy had a bandage round her knee.
sentences.chinese: 露西的膝盖上缠着绷带。

sentences.english: a knee injury
sentences.chinese: 膝伤

detailed_translations.english: the joint that bends in the middle of your leg
to hit someone with your knee

name: lawyer
trans: To lawyer is to practice law or provide legal advice.

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: load
trans: To load is to place a heavy or bulky object onto a vehicle or into a container for transportation.

sentences.english: Have you finished loading up?
sentences.chinese: 你装完货了吗？

sentences.english: It took an hour to load the van.
sentences.chinese: 给小型货车装货花了一小时。

sentences.english: Will you help me load the dishwasher?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我把碗碟放进洗碗机好吗？

sentences.english: The plane was carrying afull loadof fuel.
sentences.chinese: 飞机载满燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to put a large quantity of something into a vehicle or container
a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

name: loose
trans: To loose is to release something from a constraint or fixed position.

sentences.english: a loose floorboard
sentences.chinese: 松动的地板

sentences.english: This tooth feels very loose.
sentences.chinese: 这颗牙感觉松动得厉害。

sentences.english: The screw has come loose (= become loose ) .
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的
detailed_translations.english: not firmly fastened in place
to make something unpleasant begin

name: mirror
trans: To mirror is to reflect an image or likeness of something.

sentences.english: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
sentences.chinese: 他老是照镜子！

sentences.english: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信，我看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
sentences.chinese: 亨利脸上那苦涩的笑容跟他儿子一模一样。

sentences.english: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国出现了和英国相似的经济复苏。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in
if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

name: neck
trans: To neck is to kiss or caress someone's neck.

sentences.english: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 迈克揉了揉后颈。

sentences.english: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。

sentences.english: He patted his horse’s neck.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了拍马脖子。

sentences.english: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape  of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她有一头金发，盘在脖子后面。

sentences.english: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff of the neck into the house.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈，把它叼进了屋子。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

name: pension
trans: To pension is to retire from work and receive a regular payment from a pension fund.

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

name: plate
trans: To plate is to cover or coat a surface with a thin layer of metal or another material.

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: pleased
trans: To please is to give satisfaction or enjoyment to someone.

sentences.english: Your Dad will be so pleased.
sentences.chinese: 你爸爸会非常高兴的。

sentences.english: She seemed pleased by the compliment.
sentences.chinese: 她受了赞扬，显得很高兴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 高兴的；喜欢的；乐意做某事
detailed_translations.english: happy or satisfied

detailed_translations.chinese: 满意；愿意（please的过去分词形式）

name: proposed
trans: To propose is to suggest or put forward an idea or plan for consideration.

name: ruin
trans: To ruin is to cause something to fall into a state of decay or destruction.

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

name: ship
trans: To ship is to transport or send something, especially by sea.

sentences.english: We'll ship your order to the address we print on your cheques.
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你预订的货物送到我们印在你单据上的地址。

detailed_translations.english: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea

name: skirt
trans: To skirt is to go around the edge or border of something.

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

name: slice
trans: To slice is to cut something into thin pieces.

sentences.english: pizza slices
sentences.chinese: 比萨块

sentences.english: Cut the tomatoes into slices .
sentences.chinese: 把番茄切成片。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of food cut from a larger piece
to hit a ball, for example in tennis or golf, so that it spins sideways instead of moving straight forward

name: snow
trans: To snow is to fall from the sky as snowflakes.

sentences.english: Snow was falling heavily as we entered the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们进村的时候雪下得正大。

sentences.english: I could see footprints in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我看到雪地里有脚印。

sentences.english: The town was buried under three feet of snow.
sentences.chinese: 小镇被三英尺厚的积雪覆盖着。

detailed_translations.english: soft white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather and cover the ground
if it snows, snow falls from the sky

name: stroke
trans: To stroke is to move one's hand over something gently and repeatedly.

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: switch
trans: To switch is to change or exchange something for another.

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: tired
trans: To tire is to become exhausted or fatigued from physical or mental exertion.

sentences.english: He looks tired out (= very tired ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看起来累坏了。

sentences.english: ‘No,’ Frank said in a tired voice.
sentences.chinese: “不。”弗兰克语带疲倦地说。

detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to sleep or rest

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦；对…腻烦（tire的过去分词形式）

name: trash
trans: To trash is to discard or dispose of something as garbage.

sentences.english: Will someone take out the trash (= take it outside the house ) ?
sentences.chinese: 谁把垃圾拿出去好吗？

sentences.english: Just put it in the trash .
sentences.chinese: 就把它扔到垃圾桶里吧。

detailed_translations.english: things that you throw away, such as empty bottles, used papers, food that has gone bad etc

name: tune
trans: To tune is to adjust the pitch or melody of a musical instrument or voice.

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

name: worried
trans: To worry is to feel anxious or concerned about something.

sentences.english: She gave me a worried look.
sentences.chinese: 她担心地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: His parents must be worried sick (= extremely worried ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的父母肯定担心死了。

detailed_translations.english: unhappy because you keep thinking about a problem, or about something bad that might happen

name: zone
trans: To zone is to divide an area into different sections or categories.

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

name: anger
trans: To anger is to make someone feel mad or frustrated.

sentences.english: There is growing anger among the people against the government.
sentences.chinese: 民众对政府越来越不满。

sentences.english: What angered me most was his total lack of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of wanting to hurt or criticize someone because they have done something bad to you or been unkind to you
to make someone angry

name: award
trans: To award is to give something as a prize or honor for achievement.

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: bid
trans: To bid is to offer a price for something in an auction or sale.

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: boot
trans: To boot is to start up a computer or electronic device.

sentences.english: hiking boots
sentences.chinese: 远足靴

sentences.english: a pair of boots
sentences.chinese: 一双靴子

detailed_translations.english: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

name: bug
trans: To bug is to annoy or bother someone.

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: camp
trans: To camp is to set up a temporary shelter outdoors for recreational purposes.

sentences.english: Let’s go back to camp – it’s getting dark.
sentences.chinese: 我们回营地吧，天快黑了。

sentences.english: a camp near Lake Ellen Wilson
sentences.chinese: 埃伦•威尔逊湖边的营地

sentences.english: The soldiers broke camp (= took down their tents etc ) and left before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在黎明前拔营出发了。

sentences.english: We set up camp (= made the camping place ready ) at nearby Icicle Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们在附近的冰柱湖边建了营地。

sentences.english: The expedition’s base camp (= main camp ) was 6,000 feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 探险队的大本营在山峰下面6,000英尺处。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people stay in tents, shelters etc for a short time, usually in the mountains, a forest etc
to set up a tent or shelter and stay there for a short time

name: candy
trans: To candy is to coat or cover something with sugar or syrup.

sentences.english: ...a piece of candy.
sentences.chinese: …一块糖果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用糖煮；使结晶为砂糖；美化
糖果（等于sweets）；冰糖（等于sugar candy，rock candy）；毒品
detailed_translations.english: Candy is sweet foods such as chocolate or toffees

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的（服饰）；甜言蜜语的

name: carpet
trans: To carpet is to cover a floor with carpet or other similar material.

sentences.english: The building has been carpeted throughout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里上上下下都铺了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责
detailed_translations.english: to cover a floor with carpet
heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

name: cat
trans: To cat is to groom oneself with the tongue, like a cat does.

sentences.english: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.
sentences.chinese: 警方跟他玩了一场精心布局的猫捉老鼠游戏，诱他落网。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with four legs that people often keep as a pet

name: champion
trans: To champion is to support or defend something strongly.

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: channel
trans: To channel is to direct or guide something through a particular route or medium.

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: clock
trans: To clock is to measure the time taken to do something.

sentences.english: I heard the clock strike six (= make six loud sounds ) .
sentences.chinese: 我听到钟敲了六下。

sentences.english: The station clock was ten minutes slow (= showed a time ten minutes earlier than the real time ) .
sentences.chinese: 车站的钟慢了十分钟。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building

name: comfort
trans: To comfort is to provide solace or support to someone who is upset or distressed.

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

name: cow
trans: To cow is to intimidate or frighten someone into submission.

sentences.english: Our cow is carrying again.
sentences.chinese: 我家的母牛又怀胎了。

sentences.english: The cow is expected to calve next week.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛预期下周生小牛。

sentences.english: The cow cast a calf.
sentences.chinese: 这头母牛早产了。

detailed_translations.english: a large female animal that is kept on farms and used to produce milk or meat

name: crack
trans: To crack is to break or split something.

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

name: disappointed
trans: To disappoint is to fail to meet someone's expectations or hopes.

sentences.english: Dad seemed more disappointed than angry.
sentences.chinese: 与其说爸爸生气，倒不如说他失望。

sentences.english: disappointed customers
sentences.chinese: 失望的顾客

detailed_translations.chinese: 失望的，沮丧的；受挫折的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy because something you hoped for did not happen, or because someone or something was not as good as you expected

name: empty
trans: To empty is to remove all the contents from something.

sentences.english: an empty box
sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 空瓶子

sentences.english: an empty space behind the desk
sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

sentences.english: The fuel tank’s almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 燃油箱快要空了。

detailed_translations.english: having nothing inside

name: engineer
trans: To engineer is to design or build something using scientific or technical knowledge.

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: entrance
trans: To entrance is to captivate or fascinate someone.

sentences.english: the station entrance
sentences.chinese: 车站的入口处

sentences.english: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

detailed_translations.english: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

name: fault
trans: To fault is to blame or criticize someone or something for a mistake or problem.

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: grass
trans: To grass is to inform on someone, especially to the authorities.

sentences.english: I walked across the grass.
sentences.chinese: 我走在草地上。

sentences.english: Keep off the grass.
sentences.chinese: 请勿践踏草地。

detailed_translations.english: an area of grass, especially an area where the grass is kept cut short

name: guy
trans: To guy is to mock or tease someone in a playful way.

sentences.english: Dave’s a nice guy when you get to know him.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫是个好人，你了解他后就知道了。

sentences.english: Jake’s a real tough guy.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是个很厉害的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: a man

name: highlight
trans: To highlight is to emphasize or draw attention to something.

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: island
trans: To island is to isolate or separate something like an island.

sentences.english: I live on an island.
sentences.chinese: 我住在一个岛上。

sentences.english: Then one day, an English ship anchored near the island.
sentences.chinese: 然后有一天，一艘英国船在岛附近抛锚了。

sentences.english: This is because the island is so close to the equator. So you can choose to go whenever you like.
sentences.chinese: 就因为这个岛是如此接近赤道。所以只要你愿意你任何时候都可以去。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land completely surrounded by water

name: joke
trans: To joke is to tell a funny story or make a humorous comment.

sentences.english: I couldn’t go out with someone for a joke, could you?
sentences.chinese: 我可不能拿谈恋爱当儿戏，对不对？

sentences.english: I never joke about money.
sentences.chinese: 我从不拿钱开玩笑。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick
to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

name: jury
trans: To jury is to serve as a member of a jury in a trial.

sentences.english: the members of the jury
sentences.chinese: 陪审团成员

sentences.english: The jury found him not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定他无罪。

sentences.english: the right to trial by jury
sentences.chinese: 由陪审团进行审理的权利

detailed_translations.english: a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not

name: leg
trans: To leg is to kick or hit something with one's leg.

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
sentences.chinese: 双腿干瘦的小男孩

sentences.english: She fell and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔断了腿。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

name: lip
trans: To lip is to mouth or say something silently without making a sound.

sentences.english: She had big eyes and full lips (= large and round lips ).
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛大大的，嘴唇很丰满。

sentences.english: Matt opened the door with a smile on his lips.
sentences.chinese: 马特开了门，嘴角挂着微笑。

sentences.english: Marty kissed me right on the lips!
sentences.chinese: 马蒂一下吻在我的嘴唇上！

sentences.english: Stephen pursed his lips with distaste (= brought them together tightly into a small circle ).
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬厌恶地噘起嘴唇。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two soft parts around your mouth where your skin is redder or darker

name: mate
trans: To mate is to breed or pair animals together.

sentences.english: He has found his ideal mate.
sentences.chinese: 他已经找到了理想的配偶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 助手，大副；配偶；同事；配对物
detailed_translations.english: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies

name: nerve
trans: To nerve is to give someone the courage or confidence to do something.

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: passage
trans: To passage is to move or travel through a narrow or confined space.

sentences.english: My office is just along the passage.
sentences.chinese: 我的办公室就在过道旁边。

sentences.english: We walked down a narrow passage to the back of the building.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。

sentences.english: an underground passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

sentences.english: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥不够坚固，无法让重型车辆通过。

detailed_translations.english: a way through something

name: pen
trans: To pen is to write or compose something.

sentences.english: a ballpoint pen
sentences.chinese: 圆珠笔

sentences.english: a felt-tip pen
sentences.chinese: 毡头笔

sentences.english: a pen and ink drawing
sentences.chinese: 钢笔画

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink

name: pride
trans: To pride is to feel proud or pleased about something.

sentences.english: He wore his medals with pride.
sentences.chinese: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

sentences.english: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.chinese: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.english: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.chinese: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.english: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
sentences.chinese: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

name: priest
trans: To priest is to ordain or become a priest.

sentences.english: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.
sentences.chinese: 他接受培训成了一名天主教神父。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is specially trained to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Christian church

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成为神职人员；任命…为祭司

name: promise
trans: To promise is to make a commitment or assurance to do something.

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: resort
trans: To resort is to turn to a particular course of action as a last option.

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

name: ring
trans: To ring is to produce a sound or noise like a bell or telephone.

detailed_translations.english: a small square area surrounded by ropes, where people  box  or  wrestle

name: roof
trans: To roof is to cover a building or structure with a roof.

sentences.english: They finally found the cat up on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 他们最后在屋顶上找到了那只猫。

sentences.english: a flat roof
sentences.chinese: 平顶

sentences.english: a pitched roof
sentences.chinese: 斜顶

detailed_translations.chinese: 屋顶；最高处，顶部；最高限度
detailed_translations.english: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building, vehicle, tent etc
to put a roof on a building

name: rope
trans: To rope is to tie or secure something with a rope.

sentences.english: They tied a rope around my waist and pulled me up.
sentences.chinese: 他们在我腰间系了一根粗绳子，把我拉了上去。

sentences.english: The man was coiling a length of rope.
sentences.chinese: 那人正在卷一段绳子。

detailed_translations.english: very strong thick string, made by twisting together many thinner strings
to tie things together using rope

name: sail
trans: To sail is to travel on water in a vessel using wind power.

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.english: The trawler had sailed from the port of Zeebrugge.
sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

name: scheme
trans: To scheme is to make a plan or plot, often with a dishonest or secretive motive.

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: script
trans: To script is to write or compose a script or screenplay.

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

name: slight
trans: To slight is to insult or disrespect someone by treating them as unimportant or insignificant.

sentences.english: a slight improvement
sentences.chinese: 些许的改进

sentences.english: a slight increase
sentences.chinese: 少许的增加

sentences.english: a slight change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的略微变动

sentences.english: a slight pause
sentences.chinese: 稍稍的停顿

sentences.english: a slight problem
sentences.chinese: 小问题

detailed_translations.english: small in degree
to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

name: smart
trans: To smart is to feel a sharp, stinging pain.

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

name: sock
trans: To sock is to hit someone or something with a closed fist.

sentences.english: a pair of socks
sentences.chinese: 一双短袜

sentences.english: white ankle socks
sentences.chinese: 白色的齐踝短袜

sentences.english: Once, after a boy made a comment, she socked him.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，一个男孩子发表了一点意见，她就挥拳猛击他。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing made of soft material that you wear on your foot inside your shoe
If you sock someone or something, you hit them hard

name: station
trans: To station is to place or position something or someone in a particular location.

sentences.english: I want to get off at the next station.
sentences.chinese: 我要在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Grand Central Station
sentences.chinese: 中央火车站

sentences.english: Is there a waiting room in the station?
sentences.chinese: 车站里有候车室吗？

sentences.english: the city bus station
sentences.chinese: 市内公共汽车站

detailed_translations.english: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty

name: toe
trans: To toe is to touch or push something with one's toes.

sentences.english: He stubbed his toe (= hurt it by kicking it against something ) on a rock.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚趾踢到一块石头上受了伤。

detailed_translations.english: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot

name: tower
trans: To tower is to rise high above something, like a tower or building.

sentences.english: the Eiffel Tower
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔

sentences.english: a castle with tall towers
sentences.chinese: 有高高的塔楼的城堡

sentences.english: He towered over his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他比他的母亲高出很多。

detailed_translations.english: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc
to be much taller than the people or things around you

name: truck
trans: To truck is to transport or move goods by truck or other vehicle.

sentences.english: a truck driver
sentences.chinese: 卡车司机

detailed_translations.english: a large road vehicle used to carry goods

name: witness
trans: To witness is to see or observe an event or situation.

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned
